title: Burn Treatments
question_text:
A medical doctor is trying to determine which medical cream helps her patients recover from burns the best. She recruits the next $60$ people, and separates them into three groups $1$, $2$, and $3$. Then she assigns group $1$ cream $A$, group $2$ cream $B$, and group $3$ cream $C$. She then measures the results at the end of the study.
What are the treatments in this experiment?

choices.text: The results at the end of the experiment.

solution:
Solution

In an experiment, different conditions are assigned to the experimental units. The experimental units are those that have been recruited or offered to be a part of the study. The different conditions that are assigned to the experimental units are called treatments.

In this experiment, the doctor is trying to determine the best cream to help her patients recover. The experimental units in this study would be the $60$ patients. The treatments that were imposed on the experimental units would be the three different creams.

Choice 'D' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. All patients with burns would represent the population of interest in this experiment.

Choice 'B' is incorrect. As noted above, the 60
patients in the study make up the experimental units and the sample size.

Choice 'C' is incorrect. The doctor split the patients into three groups so she could assign the three different treatments.

Choice 'E' is incorrect. The doctor will examine the results of the study to determine which treatment that was imposed will be the most effective to help her patients.
